All,

I have using Cantera to do 1-D flames in python, and would like to 
use C++ instead.  BurnerFlame does not seem to exist in the C++ 
implementation.  Also, it seems that the example flame1.cpp found in 
examples/cxx/ is not working.  After including the "onedim.h" header 
file, I get the error messages below.  It seems that Resid1D is not 
defined.  Does anyone have a working example of a 1-D flame in C++?

Thanks,

Karl


C:\cygwin\home\Administrator\cantera-cvs\examples\cxx\flame1.cpp
(36) : error C2664: 'setKinetics' : cannot convert parameter 1 
from 'class Cantera::IdealGasMix *' to 'class Cantera::Kinetics &'
        A reference that is not to 'const' cannot be bound to a non-
lvalue
C:\cygwin\home\Administrator\cantera-cvs\examples\cxx\flame1.cpp
(37) : error C2664: 'setTransport' : cannot convert parameter 1 
from 'class Cantera::Transport ** ' to 'class Cantera::Transport &'
        A reference that is not to 'const' cannot be bound to a non-
lvalue
C:\cygwin\home\Administrator\cantera-cvs\examples\cxx\flame1.cpp
(56) : error C2065: 'Resid1D' : undeclared identifier
